speaker: Roz
text: Morning, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.  Roz, is baby Alice dressed as a little turkey or am I just very, very hungry? [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: We're flying home for Thanksgiving right after the show. I thought I'd make Alice look as cute as possible so if she cries on the plane, the other passengers can't get mad. Actually, what I like to do is keep her awake so she'll sleep on the plane.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, you should just do what I used to do.  I used to tell the passengers that if Frederick cried, I'd buy them all a drink.

speaker: Roz
text: And that worked?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  In fact, one time I awoke from a short nap, and the fellow sitting behind us was flicking the back of Frederick's little ear.  Of course that was cheating, the man did not get his drink.

speaker: Roz
text: So when is Frederick coming anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Lilith is dropping him off around noon and then she's off to visit a colleague for Thanksgiving in Vancouver.  You know, come to think of it, do they even celebrate Thanksgiving in Canada?

speaker: Roz
text: They will when she leaves! _Frasier nods in agreement as they begin the show.  FADE OUT_ **AS ALL OF VANCOUVER KNEELS TO GIVE THANKS...**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. The doorbell sounds.  Frasier answers it to reveal Lilith and Frederick._

speaker: Freddie
text: Hi, Dad. [_hugs him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Frederick, hi.

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.  Oh, gosh, you know, I was starting to get worried about you.  You're an hour late.

speaker: Freddie
text: We saw a big accident on the freeway.  Mom saved this guy's life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, that's going a bit far.  I simply applied a tourniquet.

speaker: Freddie
text: She's a hero.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_skeptically_] Yes, that's your mother all right, son.

speaker: Freddie
text: Then the paramedics came and wanted to give mom a transfusion.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_jokily_] Yes, that's your mother all right, son.

speaker: Lilith
text: If you don't mind, I'd like to use the phone and call my colleague and tell him I'll be late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.  Who is this colleague anyway?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_crosses to the phone and begins dialing_] He's the man who supplies me with lab rats.  It's about time we got together socially.  I've known him for over fifty-two generations.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Well, if the drumsticks are about this big [_shows a couple of centimeters with his fingers_], you'll know why.

speaker: Freddie
text: Good one, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, son.

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, Peter, it's Lilith.  Listen, I'm running about an hour late, so... [_pause_] Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. Well, take care of yourself.  Okay.  Goodbye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What happened?

speaker: Lilith
text: Peter's come down with something.  He thinks he caught it from the rats.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, now, nobody caught anything from a rat that wasn't resolved in a day or two, off you go.  [_N.B. History has taken it for granted that the Black Death, to which this joke is obviously referring, was bubonic plague, which would have been spread by ticks and fleas jumping off the hides of rats.  However, recent research has suggested that the Black Death might actually have been a form of anthrax, in which case the rats were innocent and the cows were to blame._]

speaker: Freddie
text: Gee, mom, why don't you spend Thanksgiving with us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's a very good one, Frederick.  Go kiss your mother goodbye and unpack, all right?

speaker: Lilith
text: Would it be so unbearable for me to be here for one meal? As soon as we're done, I'll go and check into a hotel. I can spend the weekend working on an article I've been writing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, Niles is coming this afternoon, and it'll be very uncomfortable, I think.  You know, you two haven't seen each other since your little tryst.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh please, Niles and I are adults.

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose you're right.  It would mean a lot to Frederick. After all, Thanksgiving is a time to celebrate family. _Keys are heard jingling in the corridor.  Frasier half opens the door to Martin who doesn't see the company._

speaker: Martin
text: Is the witch gone yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith's still here, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shocked then collects himself_] Oh, in that case, I'll ask you too, Lilith.  Has my twitch gone yet? [_twitches_] I had some very strong coffee this morning and...

speaker: Lilith
text: Skillfully done, Martin.

speaker: Freddie
text: Grandpa!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Freddie! [_hugs him_] How ya doing?

speaker: Freddie
text: So, Dad, is Mom staying for dinner?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, Frederick, I am.

speaker: Freddie
text: Isn't that great, Grandpa?

speaker: Martin
text: [_through his teeth_] Great, Freddie!  Real great!  Isn't that great, Freddie?!

speaker: Freddie
text: Are you okay, Grandpa?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_hanging up her coat_] He's worried about his twitch! _The doorbell sounds.  Frasier opens the door to Daphne, arms full with grocery bags, trying to tug a stubborn Eddie inside._

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on, Eddie, come on.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, he was perfectly fine until a block from here.  Then he started whining and trembling, like he senses an earthquake or a dark force or- [_not really noticing her_] hello, Lilith - a vortex of evil. [_notices her properly_] _Martin takes Eddie and carefully takes him into the kitchen, shielding him from evil with his overcoat._

speaker: Freddie
text: I'll help with the groceries.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hands them to him_] Hey, Freddie.  Thank you. [_kisses him_] Well, let's see how the turkey's coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Daphne's preparing dinner.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, should we tell her there's an extra person?

speaker: Frasier
text: No need. _Lilith takes a seat on the couch as the doorbell sounds.  Frasier answers it to Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier. _He notices Lilith and crosses to her, sitting on the couch. He becomes very monotone._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Lilith.  Lovely to see you again. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Lilith
text: Nice to see you, too.

speaker: Niles
text: I trust your flight was uneventful?

speaker: Lilith
text: Up, down, bumpy over the mountains.

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't that always the way?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith is joining us for dinner, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: What a nice surprise.

speaker: Lilith
text: It certainly is for me.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, not as nice as it is for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it, both of you! I refuse to spend the day listening to your distilled chatter!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, how would you have us behave?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why don't you try going back to your former relationship?

speaker: Lilith
text: All we did was insult each other.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  You're willing to throw all that away just because of one ill-considered night of passion?!  It happened, take from it what you can learn, move on!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I learned if you kiss her too fast you get an ice-cream headache.

speaker: Lilith
text: You also learned that I have twice your upper body strength, so shut your pie hole!

speaker: Frasier
text: Was that so hard? _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Later in the day Daphne is mashing the potatoes in the kitchen when Martin enters.  Bits of dishes are laid out on the side including a plate of cranberry sauce._

speaker: Martin
text: Wait, wait, what are you doing?!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm mashing the potatoes.

speaker: Martin
text: By hand?  You're supposed to whip potatoes, therefore every bite tastes the same.

speaker: Daphne
text: Isn't that a bit bland?

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Welcome to potatoes!  Could you just once cook a traditional Thanksgiving meal?  I mean, look at this cranberry sauce. [_points to a dish of nicely smoothed sauce_] It's supposed to keep the shape of the can, quiver a little bit. What are all these little chunks in there?

speaker: Daphne
text: Those are cranberries.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, here you are, one frozen pumpkin pie on request.

speaker: Daphne
text: Honestly, wouldn't you rather I just bake a pie from scratch?

speaker: Martin
text: Is it that you CAN'T learn or you WON'T learn? _Martin exits in disgust as Frederick enters after laying a superb arrangement on the table._

speaker: Freddie
text: I'm done setting the table.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you did set the table... [_looks_] It looks very nice, very elegant, Frederick.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yes, Freddie's been quite the little helper.  Every time I bend over to check the turkey, there he is. _Niles gives Frederick a sly look.  Meanwhile, in the room Frasier and Lilith are chatting._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Lilith, tell me about this article you are writing.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_enters_] It's about me.

speaker: Lilith
text: Essentially, yes.  I was talking to a friend that works at the _New York Times Magazine_ about raising a child after divorce and she pointed out that as a psychiatrist, I might have a unique perspective.

speaker: Freddie
text: You know, since it's about me, shouldn't I get something for it?

speaker: Lilith
text: You're not getting a minibike.

speaker: Freddie
text: But Mom...!

speaker: Lilith
text: We have talked about this.  You can get one when you are fifteen.

speaker: Freddie
text: But all my friends have minibikes.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, and if all of your friends decided to enter a Level Four biohazard area without their environmental containment suits, would you do that too?

speaker: Freddie
text: This is different!

speaker: Lilith
text: No, it's not.

speaker: Freddie
text: Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry Frederick, I'm with your mother on this one.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_from kitchen_] Dinner's almost ready!

speaker: Lilith
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Freddie
text: You know what I think, Dad?  You and mom should write this article together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure your mom can write it without my help.

speaker: Freddie
text: But it was her idea, she told me on the plane how much easier it would be.  I just don't think she knows how to ask you.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is an intriguing idea.

speaker: Martin
text: [_from kitchen_] Frasier!  I could use some help out here.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's picking the raisins out of the stuffing!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Lord!  Coming, Dad. _Daphne and Frasier exit back to the kitchen.  Then Lilith enters back from the powder room and sits with her son._

speaker: Freddie
text: You know, I think you and Dad should write this article together.

speaker: Lilith
text: Together?  Well, I think the last thing your father wants is to collaborate with me.

speaker: Freddie
text: But it was his idea.  He just told me how much fun it would be.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, it's an interesting notion. _Niles and Daphne enter from the kitchen.  Niles is carrying a carved turkey._

speaker: Daphne
text: Beautiful job carving that turkey, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I picked up a thing or two in medical school.  In case you're wondering, this bird appears to have died of a massive head trauma.

speaker: Lilith
text: Did you wash your hands, Frederick?

speaker: Freddie
text: Yeah.  Uncle Niles even showed me how to open the door with my elbow so I don't need to touch the handle.

speaker: Niles
text: What are uncles for?

speaker: Lilith
text: Daphne, is your fiancee joining us?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I'll be seeing him later.  Donny has his own Thanksgiving tradition.  He has a dinner for all the divorced men he's represented during the year.  He's hosting twenty-five today.

speaker: Lilith
text: Wow!  Twenty-five lonely, bitter men.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's been a good year. _Niles pulls out the chair next to Daphne so that he can sit by her, however Freddie beats him to it._

speaker: Freddie
text: Uncle Niles, mom's writing an article about me.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Lilith
text: It's about raising a child after divorce.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it sounds fascinating, doesn't it?  It's a subject that's very near and dear to my own heart.

speaker: Lilith
text: Are you suggesting we collaborate?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you think I might be helpful.

speaker: Freddie
text: What a great idea, you can write it together.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd be willing.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, we certainly did well on our first collaboration. [_glances at Frederick_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Lilith, we could probably get most of it done in the time you're still here in town.

speaker: Freddie
text: And if you stay here, you can finish the whole thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess it would be alright by me.

speaker: Lilith
text: Daphne, would that be too much of an imposition?

speaker: Daphne
text: Not at all, I'll be spending the weekend with Donny. [_rises_] Now, where is your father with that gravy? [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Lilith
text: Then I'll stay here.  Although maybe we should run this by your father.

speaker: Frasier
text: No need. _End of Act One.  Act Two._ **THE APPARENT TRAP** _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Lilith and Frasier working through some notes on the couch.  Lilith's hair has been taken out of its bun and they are sharing a glass of wine._

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, but I think we should have something about non custodial parents and discipline.

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly!  The weekend the father needn't be a weakened father.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_laughs_] Frasier, you still have a direct line to my funny bone.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Thank Goodness the line wasn't stop.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_laughs_] Stop!  Now, if we laugh all night, we'll never get any work done. _CUT TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Bedroom. Meanwhile, Frederick is sat on Frasier's bed playing a video game on the television screen.  He seems very much into it.  There is a knock at the door and Niles enters and sits with him._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey Frederick, I'm leaving. [_notices screen_] Whatcha doing?

speaker: Freddie
text: I'm saving the universe.  Do you want to help?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs_] I wouldn't know where to begin.

speaker: Freddie
text: It's easy, I'll show you.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, what do you do?

speaker: Freddie
text: [_hands him controller_] That's your guy, you've just escaped from an intergalactic maximum security prison pod.

speaker: Niles
text: Like they could hold me.

speaker: Freddie
text: Now once you leave this chamber, you can go left or right, and different things will happen to you.

speaker: Niles
text: What happened?

speaker: Freddie
text: Wow!  I never saw the guy trip and fall before.  Try it again, you have two lives left.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay. [_tries again but fails_] I can't seem to get out of this room, is this some sort of advanced level?

speaker: Freddie
text: No, this is like the training area.  I didn't even know you could die here!

speaker: Niles
text: [_tries again but fails_] I have to get out of this room!

speaker: Freddie
text: The reset button's on the right.  Do you want something to drink? [_rises_]

speaker: Niles
text: Quiet! _Niles carries on playing as Frederick slips out of the room.  CUT TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. A minute or two later, Frasier is washing the dishes in the kitchen. Frederick enters._

speaker: Freddie
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi son.

speaker: Freddie
text: How's the writing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's coming along nicely, thanks.

speaker: Freddie
text: Oh, mom wants to know if you're bringing over the wine?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, of course, yes. [_picks up wine glass_]

speaker: Freddie
text: You know, it's great to see you and Mom working together. I think she kinda misses you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Freddie
text: Yes, she talks about you all the time. Y ou know, how wonderful you are and how she's never met another man like you. [_pointing to glass of wine_] You go take that out to her, I'll finish up in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, son. _Frasier exits the kitchen and enters the main room.  He hands the glass to Lilith but stands firmly away from her._

speaker: Frasier
text: There you are.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_surprised_] Oh, thank you.  I've been rearranging this outline, why don't you take a look. _Lilith holds up the piece of paper.  Frasier, not wanting to get closer, briefly glances at it._

speaker: Frasier
text: Looks fine.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, you can't see it from there, sit down. [_he does_] You know, I'm really enjoying this collaboration.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me too.

speaker: Lilith
text: Is it me, or is it getting warm? [_takes her jacket off revealing her bare shoulders_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaken up_] It is a little warm! _Eddie then rushes out from the corridor and heads straight to the door. He scratches at the door with fury trying to get out as Martin follows him._

speaker: Martin
text: All right, boy, I'm coming, I'm coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rises_] Dad, let me walk you out.  There's something I want to discuss with you.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, I've never seen him so eager to take a walk, I wonder what... [_notices Lilith_] Oh, right. _Eddie, Martin and Frasier exit the apartment as Frederick enters from the kitchen._

speaker: Freddie
text: Hey, mom.  How's the article going?

speaker: Lilith
text: Very well, thank you.

speaker: Freddie
text: You know, I've never seen Dad this happy.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, what do you mean?

speaker: Freddie
text: Well, all he does is talk about you.  How pretty you look and how smart you are and how much he misses you. _Reset to: Hallway Meanwhile, Martin and Frasier are having a one to one in the corridor._

speaker: Martin
text: What makes you think she's coming on to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually Frederick told me, but you know, it actually makes sense.  I mean, this colleague of hers gets mysteriously ill and then she lassoes me into writing this article with her and then all of a sudden before I know it, the bun is off and she's waggling her bare shoulder at me.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, some of us just had a big meal! _CUT TO:  Scene Four - Frasier's Bedroom. Niles is sprawled out on the bed intensely playing the video game. A knock is heard at the door._

speaker: Niles
text: It's not your turn yet, I still have two more lives.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_enters_] It's Lilith. _As she says this the computer gives out a "scream" as Niles fails again which adds to the comic timing.  Lilith enters, shutting the door behind her, and sits on the bed next to Niles._

speaker: Lilith
text: I need to talk to you.

speaker: Niles
text: Does the door have to be closed?

speaker: Lilith
text: I thinks it's best, it's of a personal nature.

speaker: Niles
text: What's this about?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, it's about an attraction that I thought was over and now I'm beginning to think, maybe it's not.

speaker: Niles
text: Usually in my dreams, this is where I try to run and can't.

speaker: Lilith
text: This isn't about you, you egomaniac.  This is about Frasier. I think he wants us together again.

speaker: Niles
text: He knows how I feel about you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Not us!  Me and Frasier!  Is there a chair here I could talk to?!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what makes you think he wants you to get back together?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, first he offers to collaborate on this article, now he's plying me with wine and at this very moment I expect he's asking your father to clear out for the night.

speaker: Niles
text: So he took a professional interest in your article and he offered you some wine on Thanksgiving.  Now who's the egomaniac?

speaker: Lilith
text: Perhaps I am overreacting.  I'll just have to keep my eyes peeled for more conclusive evidence. _Lilith takes over the game pad and starts playing on the computer. From the way she plays, you can tell she is a pro at the game._

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't know there was a door there! _CUT TO:  Scene Five - Frasier's Aparment. In the corridor, Frasier and Martin are still conferring._

speaker: Frasier
text: Then again, maybe I've just made this whole thing up in my head.  Tell you what, Dad.  Take a minute and then come back in.  See what you think's going on in there and then find some subtle way to tell me what you think.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, okay.  Just give me a minute. _Meanwhile, inside the apartment, Frederick is lighting romantic candles.  He then turns the lights down low and switches on some light, classical music on the stereo.  As Frasier enters, his son runs off to his bedroom.  Frasier is worried by this environment.  He notices the bottle of wine on the table and quickly hides it away in the kitchen. Lilith the enters also noticing the aura of the room.  She is slightly angered by this as Frasier enters.  They confront each other._

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_worried_] Well, isn't this nice?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] Yes, very nice. _Then Martin enters, and swiftly takes in the music, the lights, the candles, and Lilith's hair and shoulders._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, excuse me again, I just came back to get an umbrella in case it rains. [_picks one up_] But I hope it doesn't, because Eddie's just dying to play this new game I taught him.  I take off his leash and I say, "Run for your life!"  That's exactly what I say, "Run for your life!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay. [_starts to leave, then_] Run for your life!

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, we have to talk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Lilith, we do.

speaker: Lilith
text: I mean, I can't just sit here all night waiting for you to make your move.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you've just got this all worked out, haven't you!

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, let's see.  Candlelight, wine, soft music.  What else do I need?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know what's worse: that you want me back or that you think I can be won so easily! [_switches off music_]

speaker: Lilith
text: You think I'm responsible for this?!

speaker: Frasier
text: You assume you can just snap your fingers and old Frasier'll come-a-runnin'?!  Well, I'm sorry, it doesn't work that way, sister.  First of all I have to be finessed!

speaker: Lilith
text: I didn't do any of this, and if you didn't either, then someone is setting us up.

speaker: Frasier
text: But who...? [_realizes_] Frederick!  He told me that you've been pining for me.

speaker: Lilith
text: He just told me the same about you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, here we are writing an article on taking your child through a divorce and our son is nursing the hopeless fantasy that we'll get back together.  We've got to go talk with him.

speaker: Lilith
text: No, wait a minute, something is not right here.  When has Frederick expressed the slightest desire to see us together?

speaker: Frasier
text: He could have been sublimating it for years.

speaker: Lilith
text: Even so, he lied to both of us.  He had to have known that we'd compare notes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, so his plan was a little artless.

speaker: Lilith
text: Unless... That's exactly what he wanted.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Lilith
text: Think about it.  He makes us believe that he wants us together, of course we have to tell him that that's not going to happen.  His hopes are dashed and we feel so guilty that we compensate by getting him something he wants.

speaker: Frasier
text: A minibike?

speaker: Lilith
text: That's a very clever little boy we have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Could he actually be so devious?

speaker: Lilith
text: Ah, well, if he wants something badly enough, he will figure out a way to get it.  Remember when he was a baby, the bottle at the end of the maze?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I kinda regret doing that.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_calls_] Frederick!

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you going to do?  Just come out and ask him?

speaker: Lilith
text: Of course not, he'll only deny it.

speaker: Frasier
text: What then?

speaker: Lilith
text: Just go with me on this one.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frederick, have a seat, we need to talk to you.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_sits_] What about?

speaker: Lilith
text: We know that you've been trying to maneuver us together and it's only natural for a child of divorce to want that. Generally speaking, your plan would be fruitless, but when your father and I let down our guard and looked at each other in the candlelight, we realized that we belong together.  In other words, we're getting remarried. _Lilith links hands with a very anxious Frasier who tries to cover this up with a broad grin._

speaker: Freddie
text: Do you really mean it? [_Frasier nods in "delight"_] This is going to be the best Christmas ever!  I'm gonna go tell Uncle Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you lost your mind?!

speaker: Lilith
text: He's cooler than I thought.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cooler?!  This isn't a game of poker!  This is our son being lied to by his parents.  We've got to go in there, tell him the truth and make it up to him.  Even if it takes a fleet of minibikes!

speaker: Lilith
text: No, no, Frasier.  Please, we called his bluff.  Now, he's calling ours.  The question is, what's our next move?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I know, why don't we just consult this handy little guide for divorced parents?! [_points to their article_]

speaker: Lilith
text: We can't blink first, we've got to up the ante.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good idea, Lilith! [_sarcastic_] You know what?  Let's go in there and promise him the baby brother he'll never have! _Frederick and Niles then enter.  Niles has an expression on his face that kills me with laughter every time I see it.  It is a mix of fake joy, worry, and anger._

speaker: Niles
text: What's this joyous news I hear?

speaker: Lilith
text: You know, Frederick, you're going to have to give up all of your friends, because we're going to live here in Seattle.

speaker: Freddie
text: I'd live anywhere to be a family again.

speaker: Niles
text: [_in one long breath_] So it is true, congratulations to you both, good night. [_heads to door_]

speaker: Freddie
text: Don't you want your coat, Uncle Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: No, thank you! _Niles walks, very stiffly, towards and out of the door, not even looking back at the "happy couple."_

speaker: Freddie
text: I'm going to go call my friends.  I love you. [_exits_]

speaker: Lilith
text: I don't understand, I was so sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gee, don't be so tough on yourself, Lilith.  After all, what parent doesn't at one time or another completely obliterate their child's chances of ever trusting another human being?!  Oh well, there he is.  Telling his friends that all of his dreams have come true.

speaker: Lilith
text: Unless that's what he wants us to think?

speaker: Frasier
text: When will you stop?! _Lilith goes over to the phone and clicks onto speaker phone on which Frederick is chatting to his friend._

speaker: Freddie
text: [_v.o._] It worked!  All I did was tap into my parents' feelings of inadequacy and they crumbled.

speaker: Boy
text: [_v.o._] What does that mean?

speaker: Freddie
text: I'm getting the minibike.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_into phone_] Frederick.

speaker: Freddie
text: Uh-oh! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Lilith
text: Do I know my son, or do I know my son?

speaker: Frasier
text: He was willing to put us through absolute hell just for a minibike?

speaker: Lilith
text: You know what this means, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes... he's normal.  We're not bad parents.  Well done, Dr. Sternin.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well done, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, we really should get in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I suppose we should.  Must be sheer torment for him, waiting for the axe to fall.

speaker: Lilith
text: Absolute hell.

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolute nightmare.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Wine?

speaker: Lilith
text: Love some. _Frasier hands Lilith her wine glass as they sit down to relax.  End of Act Two._
